Unfortunately steam doesn't allow to post neutral reviews and for me, the game felt not as good and polished as half-life 1 that's why it's a negative review. Also, I've encountered a few bugs and glitches during my playthrough, nothing crazy but at one point I had to use my save, which was 5 minutes before, to fix the door which didn't want to open due to something.
The game itself is the same, but many things are different. It has some absolutely new weapons (which are terrible) and enemies. Some new mechanics are interesting and add an additional challenge to the game. The only thing that I really didn't like is that compared to half-life 1 this DLC doesn't have hidden places where you can find something useful, so it makes no sense for a player to look into different corners for a hidden secret from game devs.
Efsane...

Very good expansion to the half life story and gameplay. you would expect an expansion to just use the same assests and add nothing new but this game delivers on so much and is one of my personal favs in the half life series. I highly recomend you pick this up if you're a fan of the series.

I've played Opposing Force for an estimate of 7 hours, as I can recall correctly. I enjoyed playing this game and had a fun time with it. I would say 8.5/10 for this one. 

Throughout the game, it felt very much like playing Half-Life 1 but 2.0, because of the addition of friendlies, enemies, and weapons. In my opinion, this game is way better than Blue-Shift.

There is a couple of drawbacks, that I dislike of how mindless the friendly allies' ai were when I commanded them, and the game was too short, though, it is only an expansion. That's all I comply with.

As a expansion, Valve and Gearbox Software made a great job with this. 

The story adds more to Half Life lore. You play as Adrian Shephard, a HECU marine sent to Black Mesa to end the alien invasion and incident, altough things get harder and Shephard has to make his way fighting aliens. 

As the game uses Valve's old engine, the visuals are not a wonder, but it gives the original Half Life ambience.

Enemies are not just the Xen aliens, but there are new aliens that make the plot way more deep. 

Weapons are really similar to it's base game, but there are new ones too, like a barnacle that helps you reach areas, a machine gun or a sniper rifle.

Multiplayer is useless and dead, so expect nothing from it.

And finally, price. Honestly this game is a huge deal being less than 5‚Ç¨, and for five hours more or less of fun. This game made me get into the Half Life saga, so I recommend it no matter if you already were into the saga or are new to it.
